Title: Object: Repos en Egypte
Series: Galerie du Palais Royal
Description: Rest on the flight into Egypt: landscape with in the centre foreground the Holy Family sitting around a large stone, and the infant Baptist bringing a lamb before Child Christ; three cherubic heads hover above the group; trees in the background; after a composition formerly attributed to Titian, now to Polidoro da Lanciano; with engraved text below. 1786/1807 Etching and engraving
Curator's comments: From 'Galerie du Palais Royal', a set published between 1786 and 1808; see 1837,0408.317 for comment. Reproduction in reverse of a composition known through a painting in the Louvre (inv. 745) and several copies; this plate was engraved after a canvas then in the collection of Orléans and later in the Holford Collection, London. The Louvre painting is now attributed to Polidoro da Lanciano. See Wethey, 1969, cat. No. X-14.
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
